decision_conditions: The Oak is situated within the rear garden of 115 The Larches, it can be seen from the highway both above and between the properties and also from the school to the rear. As a result, this Oak has a high amenity value. It significantly contributes to the arboreal character of the local area.

The applicant's work description is a bit confusing however it is understood that they wish to carry out a lateral crown reduction with the final canopy stretching 5m in each direction. No arboricultural reasons have been provided as to why this work is required. The application does mention to maintain a balanced shape however the tree does not appear to be drastically unbalanced in its current state. The proposed work would drastically reduce the trees canopy, introducing multiple large multiple wounds into its crown which would likely cause stress and lead to infection, affecting its long-term health. Pruning would also result in weakly attached re-growth forming that would be prone to future fa
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
description: To carry out tree surgery, including a crown reduction to 5m from the tree stem on One Oak T1 in TPO 765
